txt.en: You have found insects in Gamli's bed
Gamli the dwarf harbours fears that something might be hiding within his bedding.
'By Durin's Beard! What madness is this!?'

'Ho there, friend! You don't see anything... moving... in my bed, do you?

'My sleep has been quite disturbed of late by the feeling of something crawling across my skin. I refuse to lay beneath those blankets again until I am assured there is nothing alive within them.

'Take a look for me, [placeholder]. I dare not touch the blankets.'
Gamli's bed is in the Durin's Threshold camp.\n\nGamli seems concerned that there might be something hiding in his bed.

'This is intolerable! Insects rustling around where I lay my head is quite unacceptable! It is not to be borne, I tell you!

'Where did those hideous little things come from? We have hardly been here a day, and already we are infested.

'I think now I shall need a thorough wash....'
Gamli is at the Durin's Threshold camp.\n\nYou should speak with Gamli regarding what you found in his bed.
Wafri is at the Dolven-view camp.\n\nGamli wishes you to speak to his friend Wafri, who has some knowledge of the insects that infest Khazad-d√ªm.
'Don't you see those awful things crawling in my bed?'

'Tiny insects in Gamli's bedding? How curious.\n\n'The larger Gredbyg infest several areas within Moria, but their tiny young could not have found their way into Gamli's bed unless there is a nest or lair quite close by. I think it might be best if we found it, and soon!'
'Go talk to Wafri...he'll know what to do about those bugs!'
Talk to Wafri at the Dolven-view camp
